snippet: Rapid growth and sweeping economic changes have pushed up retail rents in many of Asia’s largest cities, but nowhere have they reached the stratospheric heights of Hong Kong.
abstract: Rapid growth and sweeping economic changes have pushed up retail rents in many of Asia’s largest cities, but nowhere have they reached the stratospheric heights of Hong Kong; rent increases have squeezed out many of the colorful mom and pop stores that form large part of city's business ecosystem, changing the face of many neighborhoods in process.

byline.original: By BETTINA WASSENER and MARY HUI

lead_paragraph: Rapid growth and sweeping economic changes have pushed up retail rents in many of Asia’s largest cities, but nowhere have they reached the stratospheric heights of Hong Kong.

headline.main: Hong Kong Rents Push Out Mom and Pop Stores
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Rents Push Out Mom and Pop Stores

keywords.value: Off Broadway Boutique (Manhattan, NY, Retail Store)
